channel.title: FScript BÃ©ta
channel.description:
Well, I'm working on a scriptable macroing program like SCAR and i tought, why not release an ealy bÃ©ta version :rolleyes:
Its scripted in VBScript It has color syntax And other standard stuff :P
Also, I haven't yet build in a function to stop the scripts, so it would be best to build in some failsafe loops in case something goes wrong, affcourse, when it's stuck somewhere it will propably give the user the option to stop the script.
It would be very nice if some people would make or try to make some scripts to get it started.
[size=20pt]Commands:[/size]
[code]WriteLn(Text As String) - Like SCAR it adds a line to the debug window. MoveMouse(X As Long, Y As Long, [Window As Long]) - Instantly moves the mouse to the specified spot. GetMousePos([Window As Long]) As String - Returns the current mouse position as a string: "X,Y" GetX(XY As String) As Long - Returns the X coordinate of the XY string many functions like GetMousePos return. GetY(XY As String) As Long - Same as GetX for the Y coordinate. MoveMouseSmooth(X As Long, Y As Long, [Window As Long]) - Moves the mouse in a humanlike way. MoveMouseSmoothFrom(X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, [Window As Long]) - Moves the mouse from, to the given coordinates. MoveMouseSmoothEx(X As Long, Y As Long, [MinSleepTime As Long = 3], [MaxSleepTime As Long = 8], [MaxDistance As Long = 20], [Gravity As Long = 20], [Forces As Long = 10], [Window As Long]) - Moves the mouse influenced by gravity and other factors. (Standard settings are the same as MoveMouseSmooth) MoveMouseSmoothFromEx(X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, [MinSleepTime As Long = 3], [MaxSleepTime As Long = 8], [MaxDistance As Long = 20], [Gravity As Long = 20], [Forces As Long = 10], [Window As Long]) - Same as MoveMouseSmoothEx, but from, to the given coordinates. Random(RandNum As Long) As Long - Returns a random value from 1 to the given number. Pow(Base As Double, Exponent As Long) As Double - Returns the powers of the given base with the given exponent. Min(I1 As Long, I2 As Long) As Long - Returns the smallest of the 2 given numbers. Max(I1 As Long, I2 As Long) As Long - Returns the largest of the 2 given numbers. Wait(MS As Long) - Wait for a given number of milliseconds. HoldMouse(X As Long, Y As Long, Left As Boolean, [Window As Long]) - Holds a mousebutton. ReleaseMouse(X As Long, Y As Long, Left As Boolean, [Window As Long]) - Releases a mousebutton. ClickMouse(X As Long, Y As Long, Left As Boolean, [Interval As Long], [Window As Long]) - Clicks the mouse in a humanlike way. (You can choose the interval between holding and releasing the mousebutton yourself if preferred) GetColor(X, Y As Long, [Window As Long]) As Long - Gets the color at the given coordinates. FindColor(Color As Long, [Window As Long]) As String - Finds a color in the whole specified window and returns an XY string. FindColorBox(Color As Long, X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, [Window As Long]) As String - Finds a color within the given area and returns an XY string. SendKeys(Text As String, [Wait]) - Sends keys. (Standard VB function) SendKeysHuman(Text As String) - Sends keys in a humanlike way. (Does not press enter/return afterwards, you have to add chr(13) for that) OpenURL(Url As String) As String - Opens an URL and returns it as a string. GetRank(Username As String, Skill As String) As String - Gets the rank of a users skill in the runescape highscores. GetLvl(Username As String, Skill As String) As String - Gets the lvl of a users skill in the runescape highscores. GetXP(Username As String, Skill As String) As String - Gets the exp of a users skill in the runescape highscores. GetCombat(Username As String) As String - Calculates a users combatlvl. (Not 100% accurate) FindColorSpiral(Color As Long, X As Long, Y As Long, X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, [Window As Long]) As String - Finds a color in a given area spiraling from the inside out. (X and Y are the coordinates where it starts searching, it willl stop when it reaches 1 of the borders of the specified area, it won't always search the whole area) SimilarColors(Color1 As Long, Color2 As Long, Tolerance As Long) As Boolean - Returns if the 2 specified colors are within eachothers range with the givenh tolerance as true or false. FindColorTolerance(Color As Long, Tolerance As Long, [Window As Long]) As String - Searches for a color, similar to the given one with the given tolerance in the whole specified window. FindColorBoxTolerance(Color As Long, X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, Tolerance As Long, [Window As Long]) As String - Searches for a color, similar to the given one with the given tolerance in the specified area. FindColorSpiralTolerance(Color As Long, X As Long, Y As Long, X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, Tolerance As Long, Optional Window As Long) As String - Finds a color similar to the given one with the given tolerance, in a given area spiraling from the inside out. ReadFile(FilePath As String) As String - Reads a file and returns it as a string. SetGlobalWindow(Window As Long) - Sets the programs selected client window with the by you specified window. GetWindowByName(Name As String) As Long - Gets the window handle of a window with the specified name/caption/title. Enter() - Send an enter/return/chr(13) key. LoadPrefix(Prefix As String) - Loads the internal runescape client with the specified prefix. SetClientHandle() - Sets the programs selected client window with the windowhandle of the build-in client. CloseClient() - Closes the build-in client. Mouse(X As Long, Y As Long, left As Boolean, [Window As Long]) - Moves the mouse to the given coordinates and clicks. MouseBox(X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, left As Boolean, [Window As Long]). Moves the mouse and clicks inside the specified area. Login(Username As String, Password As String, [Window As Long]) - Logs an account in. LoadAccount(Prefix As String, Username As String, Password As String, [Window As Long]) - Opens the build-in client with the specified prefix, waits until it is loaded and logs a specified account in. GetRunningTime() - Gets the time the program has been running in seconds.[/code]
[size=20pt]Small scripting examples:[/size]
[u]Displaying Zezima's overall lvl in a messagebox:[/u] [code]Sub Main() MsgBox GetLvl("Zezima", "Overall") End Sub[/code]
[u]Auto-Pong (http://www.xnet.se/javaTest/jPong/jPong.html):[/u] [code]Sub Main() Do Until a = True If XY = FindColorBox(16777215, 49, 41, 278, 221) Then b = b + 1 End If If b = 20 Then Exit Sub End If MoveMouse GetX(FindColorBox(16777215, 49, 41, 278, 221)), GetY(FindColorBox(16777215, 49, 41, 278, 221)) XY = FindColorBox(16777215, 49, 41, 278, 221) Wait 100 Loop End Sub[/code] I know that its a bit weird that i use 2 findcolorbox procedures to get both coordinates, but when i use variables i get errors and such, gotta figure that out first... But this little crappy script demonstrates the failsafe i talked about, when you or the oponent has scored a point, it will stop because the ball doesnt move anymore, i didnt make it continue because it's just a basic example :)
[u]Loading the build-in client with world 1 and setting it as the default client window:[/u] [code]Sub Main() LoadPrefix "ul2" Wait 2000 SetClientHandle End Sub[/code]
[size=20pt]Updates:[/size]
[code]1.00 - Initial release. 1.01 - Fixed GetCombat command. Added ReadFile command. 1.10 - Fixed the bug with saving scripts. Added a build-in client. Added SetGlobalWindow(Window As Long). Added GetWindowByName(Name As String) As Long. Added Enter(). Added LoadPrefix(Prefix As String). Added SetClientHandle(). Added CloseClient(). 1.20 - Fixed error when cancelling while loading or saving a script. Fixed the mouseclicking. Fixed the Random(RandNum As Long) function. Added Mouse(X As Long, Y As Long, left As Boolean). Added MouseBox(X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, left As Boolean). Added Login(Username As String, Password As String). Added LoadAccount(Prefix As String, Username As String, Password As String) 1.30 - Fixed GetMousePos. Added GetRunningTime() As Long.[/code]
[size=20pt]Prefix List:[/size]
[code]Prefix - World - Location
ul2 1 'San Francisco (UL)' ul4 2 'San Francisco (UL)' po3 3 'San Jose (PO)' po4 4 'San Jose (PO)' po5 5 'San Jose (PO)' po6 6 'San Jose (PO)' above2 7 'San Jose (AB)' above3 8 'San Jose (AB)' above4 9 'San Jose (AB)' jolt7 10 'London (JO)' jolt8 11 'London (JO)' jolt9 12 'London (JO)' nl3 13 'San Francisco (NL)' nl4 14 'San Francisco (NL)' uk2 15 'London (DS)' uk3 16 'London (DS)' tor1 17 'Toronto' tor2 18 'Toronto' nl7 19 'San Francisco (NL)' nl8 20 'San Francisco (NL)' nl11 21 'San Francisco (NL)' nl1 22 'San Francisco (NL)' uk4 23 'London (DS)' uk5 24 'London (DS)' nl12 25 'San Francisco (NL)' ul5 26 'San Francisco (UL)' nl5 27 'San Francisco (NL)' nl6 28 'San Francisco (NL)' ul6 29 'San Francisco (UL)' po7 30 'San Jose (PO)' po8 31 'San Jose (PO)' ul1 32 'San Francisco (UL)' at1 33 'Atlanta' at2 34 'Atlanta' at3 35 'Atlanta' at4 36 'Atlanta' tor3 37 'Toronto' planet1 38 'Dallas' planet2 39 'Dallas' planet3 40 'Dallas' planet4 41 'Dallas' po2 42 'San Jose (PO)' sl11 43 'St Louis' at6 44 'Atlanta' planet5 45 'Dallas' planet6 46 'Dallas' above5 47 'San Jose (AB)' above6 48 'San Jose (AB)' ams1 49 'Amsterdam' ams2 50 'Amsterdam' ams3 51 'Amsterdam' ams4 52 'Amsterdam' ams5 53 'Amsterdam' ams6 54 'Amsterdam' ch1 55 'Chicago' nl10 56 'San Francisco (NL)' ch3 57 'Chicago' ch4 58 'Chicago' ch5 59 'Chicago' ch6 60 'Chicago' se1 61 'Seattle' se2 62 'Seattle' se3 63 'Seattle' se4 64 'Seattle' se5 65 'Seattle' se6 66 'Seattle' jolt10 67 'London (JO)' jolt11 68 'London (JO)' jolt12 69 'London (JO)' sl10 70 'St Louis' uk7 71 'London (DS)' sl1 72 'St Louis' sl2 73 'St Louis' sl3 74 'St Louis' sl4 75 'St Louis' sl5 76 'St Louis' sl6 77 'St Louis' sl7 78 'St Louis' sl8 79 'St Louis' jolt1 80 'London (JO)' jolt2 81 'London (JO)' jolt3 82 'London (JO)' jolt4 83 'London (JO)' jolt5 84 'London (JO)' ny1 85 'New York' ny2 86 'New York' ny4 87 'New York' ny5 88 'New York' ny6 89 'New York' ny7 90 'New York' ny8 91 'New York' nl9 92 'San Francisco (NL)' mi1 93 'Miami' mi2 94 'Miami' mi3 95 'Miami' mi4 96 'Miami' mi5 97 'Miami' mi6 98 'Miami' mi7 99 'Miami' ul3 100 'San Francisco (UL)' at7 101 'Atlanta' at8 102 'Atlanta' at9 103 'Atlanta' at10 104 'Atlanta' uk8 105 'London (DS)' uk9 106 'London (DS)' au1 107 'Sydney' au2 108 'Sydney' au3 109 'Sydney' au4 110 'Sydney' au5 111 'Sydney' au6 112 'Sydney' tor4 113 'Toronto' tor5 114 'Toronto' tor6 115 'Toronto'[/code]
[size=20pt]Future Updates:[/size]
[code]Standard Functions: - GetTextCorner([Window As Long]) As String - TakeScreenshot(FilePath As String, [Format As String], [Window As Long]) - FindBitmap(Bitmap As String, [Window As Long]) As String - FindBitmapBox(Bitmap As String, X1 As Long, Y1 As Long, X2 As Long, Y2 As Long, [Window As Long]) As String - MouseR(X As Long, Y As Long, XR As Long, XY As Long, Left As Boolean, [Window As Long]) - ...
RSRelated Functions: - OpenTab(Tab As Long) - LoggedIn() As Boolean - ...[/code]

item.title: FScript BÃ©ta
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Lol, I have no idea what you're talking about

[News=FScript]

[i]March 3th 2006

I've got a way to stop scripts now, but it will require to close the program. This isn't a major problem by itself, but it also means that the client will be closed => account logged out. There are however 2 ways to solve this:

  • Relog the account when the program has restarted... (Hard way [has to get the accountdata somehow])
  • Make a separed exe for the client and make a way for the program to communicate. (Hard way as well :D)[/i]

[/News]

I'd go for the second option, the communication is the hardest part, but I've worked with a similar thing before, so it might just work.

Read full topic

item.title: FScript BÃ©ta
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

I c

EDIT:

I have rewritten my featherbuyer script from scar for FScript with some safeguards because you can't stop it manually.
It will be released with the next version.
You will also be able to get the number of seconds the program has been running to create progress reports.
And the GetMousePos function will be fixed.

The Featherbuying script will have a lot of comments, very interresting for those who want to learn to script it.
It holds variables, safeguards, a progressreport, etc...

EDIT2:

I've uploaded v1.30! It has a scripts folder with the featherbuyer included, have fun

Read full topic
